elements.title: Lakshmeshwara Jain temples
elements.contents: ... that the Shanka Basadi (pictured), one of the Lakshmeshwara Jain temples, features a rare monolithic pillar with the carving of 1008 tirthankaras known as the Sahasrakuta Jinabimba?

elements.title: James A. Gilmore
elements.contents: ... that James A. Gilmore reorganized the Federal League, hoping that it would become a third major league?

elements.title: Survivalcraft
elements.contents: ... that Survivalcraft, a game inspired by Minecraft, was once one of the most downloaded games on Windows Phone and iPad?

elements.title: Thomas Leyland
elements.contents: ... that the slave trader Thomas Leyland won a lottery, transported 22,365 enslaved Africans, and became Lord Mayor of Liverpool?

elements.title: Women's National Basketball Players Association
elements.contents: ... that the Women's National Basketball Players Association was the first trade union for professional women athletes?

elements.title: Shimaguchi Komao
elements.contents: ... that before he died in the Battle of Iwo Jima, Japanese composer Shimaguchi Komao left behind an unfinished song bidding farewell to his family?

elements.title: coat of arms of Montserrat
elements.contents: ... that the coat of arms of Montserrat features Erin holding a Celtic harp, alluding to the Irish immigrants to the island during the 17th century?

elements.title: Last Train to San Fernando
elements.contents: ... that when Johnny Duncan performed "Last Train to San Fernando" in Liverpool, the audience included John Lennon, Paul McCartney, and George Harrison?
